name: Chamath Palihapitiya
tweet: Vaccines: Equity (politicians decide) vs Equality (if you want it, get it)  Climate: Equity (politicians decide) vs Equality (we all have the same right to the same clean air)  Taxes: Equity (politicians decide) vs Equality (no hidden rules for the rich, same rules for everyone)

name: Chamath Palihapitiya
tweet: Politicians use the word "equity" a lot.  More often than not, it's about control and power.  Equity is what an owner gives an employee.  Equality is when we are all on the same, level playing field.  Equality is what we deserve, but (meager) equity is usually what we  get.

name: Chamath Palihapitiya
tweet: Companies aren't prepared for this.  Capital markets have no sense of it.  Yet climate legislation marches forward.  We are supporters of carbon tariffs and want to help build solutions.  Meanwhile, we update our models... üò¨

name: Chamath Palihapitiya
tweet: A carbon tariff would require every company to have a detailed provenance of the energy used to produce a good or service entering a border.  Love that iPhone case? It's price will depend on how much coal was burned in China to make it.  More coal == more tariff == more cost.

name: Chamath Palihapitiya
tweet: Imagine a new trade war between the US and China.  Or imagine an increasingly aggressive European Union fighting climate change.   The simplest solution to enact both would be a carbon tariff.

name: Chamath Palihapitiya
tweet: The biggest risk/correlation to equity markets over the next decade has nothing to do with interest rates.  It will be carbon tariffs and it will blow up every DCF model of every company in the public markets...
